intro: Pritzelago brevicaulis var. drexlerae, commonly known as the dwarf pritzelago, is a rare and distinctive plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The flowers are usually pale green to yellowish, with a unique structure that sets it apart from other members of the genus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
